--- Title: Magic Hexagon Proposer: Toby Walsh Category: - Design and configuration - Combinatorial mathematics - Games and puzzles --- A magic hexagon consists of the numbers 1 to 19 arranged in a hexagonal pattern: 
A,B,C
D,E,F,G
H,I,J,K,L
M,N,O,P
Q,R,S
We have a constraint that all diagonals sum to 38. That is, 
A+B+C = D+E+F+G = ... = Q+R+S = 38,
A+D+H = B+E+I+M = ... = L+P+S = 38,
C+G+L = B+F+K+P = ... = H+M+Q = 38.
The problem can be generalized to other sizes. This is the diameter 5 problem.
